Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 150 words that follows your plan. Check your work for readability.

Human aging is a natural process that happens to everyone. It's like a clock ticking, marking time in our lives. As we grow older, our bodies change in many ways. Our skin might wrinkle and our hair could turn gray or fall out. Our bones can become weaker and our muscles might not be as strong as they once were. Our minds also change; we might have a harder time remembering things or learning new skills. But don't worry, these changes happen slowly over time. Also, everyone ages differently, so these changes might not happen in the same way or at the same time for everyone. Even though aging is a normal part of life, scientists are always trying to understand it better and find ways to help us live healthier, longer lives.

Human aging is a process where our bodies change over time. This happens to everyone as they grow older. Our cells, which are the tiny building blocks of our body, start to function differently. Some cells stop making new ones, while others can't repair themselves as well. This makes us more susceptible to diseases and injuries. Our bones, muscles, and skin also change. Bones become weaker, muscles lose their strength, and skin loses its elasticity. Our senses, like sight and hearing, might not work as well either. But remember, aging is a natural part of life, and there are many ways to stay healthy and happy as we get older.

**Human Aging**

Human aging is a natural process that happens to everyone as they grow older. It's like when a plant goes from a seed to a sapling, and eventually becomes a full-grown tree. Our bodies change too, as we get older. For instance, our skin might get wrinkles, our hair might turn gray or fall out, and we might not be as strong or flexible as we were when we were younger. Our brains also change, which can make us forget things or take longer to learn new things. But don't worry, these changes happen slowly over time, and it's a normal part of life.

Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

Aging is like a journey that everyone takes. It starts when we are born and continues throughout our lives. As we age, our bodies and minds change in many ways. Our skin might get wrinkles, our hair might turn gray or fall out, and our muscles might not be as strong as they used to be. Our brains might not remember things as quickly as before, and we might need glasses to see things clearly.

But aging isn't just about these physical changes. It's also about the experiences and knowledge we gain over time. As we age, we learn new things and have new experiences that help us grow and change. We might become wiser and more understanding of the world around us.

In short, aging is a natural and inevitable part of life. It's a journey that everyone takes at their own pace, and it's an important part of what makes us human.
